Few Suggestions :

Date: 1️⃣Title label use Mud Yellow color / black for that asthetic appeal for background
2️⃣Clear & Home button alignment and cards size is not up to the mark
3️⃣Sort the product brand when you are showcasing on on the order of Profit Margin or whatever is the business problem you are trying to showcase

4️⃣Use preferably different color apart from green if you have white background. Best color for background is black/yellow/white while you can use other color for cards.Refer novypro.com for such detailing so that you hav e the complete picture
5️⃣Use the same formatting(color+font+size) for all the numbers and keep it white preferably (if black background)

Message: Change the background color . Pink is not at all recommended as the data points and graph doesn’t appear properly . Rather use black/yellow/white as a background with various color combinations for charts and keep all the numbers in a single format and color (preferable white)

Few Suggestions which help you learning in a better way : 
1️⃣ Work on the  colors 🎨 combination.
2️⃣ Use background color preferably Black ,       
Yellow or White
3️⃣ Don’t use PIE-CHART rather use 
DONUT 🍩 chart 📊 rather
4️⃣ Work on the alignment
5️⃣ Use the same data formatting for all th cards 💳 & numbers ☝️

Give state as a drop-down rather than check box ✅ Donut 🍩 chart 📊 looks great 👍 Maintain a uniformity in data figure for Sales,Profit & Quantity and remove the SUM word.These small suggestions once implemented can really enhance your analytical 💬 thinking 🧐 skills.

It’s a disclaimer which every one should follow : while working in any ANALYTICS industry - One  should NEVER ❌ ever used 3D effects in your chart that I not at all recommended.Why ? I would explain that . These dashboards which you see they go to the market PRODUCTION side and at the end they use it be it for the MARKET/HIGHER MANAGEMENT folks who likes to see data in readable format and not in 3D visual effects after all it’s a number game in dashboard not a PAINTING CLASS 
.
.
~So never ever use any 3D effects in your visualisation .

~ Never use dark color in your visualisation except black/yellow/white/Grey.If you are using black background,have yellow tiles or blue or red.Avoid pink for sure 

~ Never use any grid lines for any of your chart be it line chart,bar-graph or any 
.
.
Follow above steps so that you can ace your interview even .This I am telling from my experince and after working on beyond 50+ BUSINESS dashboards . Hope I am enlightening the community….

Nidhi Shukla  - it will be really difficult for anyone to understand the flow - follow this - break your code in chunks by creating different table - and the perform joins on them - in that way your code will be ways to understand and anyone can get the flow - the above code computation time will be high and one can waste resources easily by consuming credits if it’s running on CLOUD ☁️ environment - try to avoid SUBQUERY and CTEs unless and until it is required and pass all the subsequent to a TABLE and then the final query you take it from that table . That’s how your code gets optimised and consume less resources by creating less overheard on the SYSTEM👩‍💻

Date: Key Takeaways:
1.Different types of data - categorical vs time series
2.Finding opportunities in data inorder to increase the sale
3.Pick the data for which KPI is easily available.
4.Follow hierarchy while doing exploratory data analysis(EDA)
5.Find the right chart for the analysis such as HEAT MAP to look for more accurate findings.
6.Look for the opportunities which is less than the average for that particular category in order to do EDA.
7.Knock out heavier opportunities.
